name: construction_techniques
chinese_name: 信息学竞赛中构造题的常用解题方法
author: 蒋凌宇
complexity: Varies by problem; typical complexities include O(n + m) for graph-based constructions and O(n) for recursive or combinatorial constructions.
summary: This paper discusses common techniques for solving construction problems in algorithm competitions, including the pigeonhole principle, DFS trees, and recursion. It presents several example problems such as Errich-Tac-Toe, Mine Sweeper II, Ehab's Last Corollary, Scenic Walkway Partition, Baggage, and Strange Housing, illustrating how to apply these methods to construct valid solutions under given constraints.
